\lyxend\lyxslide{Course Schedule}
Course webpage : \url{http://hkoi.mathdb.org}

Previous training material: \url{http://game.integate.net/hkoi/}

Almost every Saturaday, from $10am$ to $12pm$

Location: Computer Room 10 of Methodist College\pause

\medskip{}
Dates:

27-Feb, 6-Mar, 13-Mar, 27-Mar

10-Apr, 17-Apr, 24-Apr

8-May, 15-May, 22-May, 29-May

5-Jun, 26-Jun

3-Jul (Examination)

\emph{No lesson on 20-Mar, as I will be at PuiChing Middle School.}

\medskip{}
\pause
You are required to submit homework \emph{at the beginning} of the
lessons.

There will be around three quizzes and one examination.

Homework problems are related to all you learnt in school.\pause

\emph{NO Calculator is allowed!!!} 
\lyxend\lyxslide{Topics - Math}
\begin{itemize}
	\item Discrete Mathematics
		\pause
		\begin{enumerate}
		\item Propositional logic\onslide*{+1}{
			\begin{enumerate}
				\item Statements - negation, conjunction, disjunction and condition
				\item Truth values - TRUE , FALSE
				\item Boolean algebra
				\item Recursive definition
			\end{enumerate}
		}\pause[2]
		\item Mathematical induction\onslide*{+1}{
			\begin{enumerate}
				\item well-ordering principle
				\item identity for sum of powers
				\item identity for sum of geometric sequence
			\end{enumerate}
		}\pause[2]
		\item Set theory, relations and functions\onslide*{+1}{
			\begin{enumerate}
			\item equivalence relation and classes
			\item domain, codomain and image
			\end{enumerate}
		}\pause[2]
		\item Number theory\onslide*{+1}{
			\begin{enumerate}
				\item Divisibility
				\item Division algorithm and Euclidean algorithm
				\item Modular arithmetic - Addition, subtraction and multiplication.
				\item The congruence classes modulo $n$
				\item Modular arithmetic - Inverse (division)
			\end{enumerate}
		}\pause[2]
		\item Abstract algebra\onslide*{+1}{
			\begin{enumerate}
				\item Units of $\mathbb{Z}_{p}$
				\item Fermat's little theorem
				\item Chinese remainder theorem
				\item Euler's phi-function
			\end{enumerate}			
		}\pause[2]
		\item Counting\onslide*{+1}{
			\begin{enumerate}
				\item Permutation
				\item Combinatorial binomial coefficient
				\item Combination
				\item Pigeonhole principle
				\item Inclusion-exclusion principle
			\end{enumerate}	
		}\pause[2]
		\item Sequences and recurrence relations\onslide*{+1}{
			\begin{enumerate}
				\item Algebraic binomial coefficient
				\item Fibonacci sequence
				\item Solve recurrence relations
				\item Generating function
			\end{enumerate}
		}\pause[2]
		\end{enumerate}
\end{itemize}
\lyxend{}
\begin{slide}{Topics - Programming}
\begin{itemize}
	\item Programming
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item<1> C-syntax - statement, expression and printf
		\item<2> Variables, data Types and identifier
		\item<3> Control flow (Condition)- if-else and switch
		\item<4> Control flow (Looping) - while, do-while and for
		\item<5> Functions - pass by value
		\item<6> Arrays, string and pointer
		\item<7> Functions - pass by pointer
		\item<8> Algorithm
	\end{enumerate}
\end{itemize}
\end{slide}

	\end{itemize}
